summary:
The Security Council,
Reaffirming the purposes and principles of the Charter of the United Nations and its relevant resolutions, particularly resolution 1373 (2001), 
 Condemns in the strongest terms the 12 October 2002 bomb attacks in Bali, Indonesia, and other recent terrorist acts, regarding them as threats to international peace and security. 
 Expresses deepest sympathy and condolences to the Government and people of Indonesia, and the victims' families. 
 Urges all States to cooperate with and assist the Indonesian authorities in finding and bringing to justice the perpetrators, organizers and sponsors of these attacks, in accordance with resolution 1373 (2001). 
 Expresses its reinforced determination to combat all forms of terrorism, in accordance with its responsibilities under the Charter of the United Nations.
